alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Judith Basin County and Judith Gap; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:40PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Judith Basin and southeastern Fergus Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 333 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just south of Judith Gap with additional thunderstorms developing across Fergus county. These storms will generally track northeast at 20 mph with the strongest cell tracking east across the Snowies. Hail up to the size of nickels is expected with the storm moving across the Snowies and this storm has a history of producing significant accumulations of hail. Additional storms developing across Fergus county may produce hail up to one half inch in diameter with all cells producing brief but locally heavy rainfall and lightning. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Grass Range, Forestgrove, Giltedge, Glengarry, Heath and Garneill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
